name: Music Camp 2025 - Music Summer Camp
description:
As we melt away this summer, we may as well do it to a beat. Taaqademy Presents - Music Camp 2025
Camp Content

Song Learning - Students will develop a repertoire of songs that they can perform
Everyone gets exposed to and gets to touch and feel all instruments - Gtr, Drums, Keys, Ukulele, Percussion, Vocals.
Students can choose a preferred stream of learning: Guitar, Keyboard, Drums, Vocals. (Or our teacher can help you choose too)
Music Appreciation - designed to enrich the student's listening experience by introducing various instruments, genres, history & evolution of styles, artists.
Basic Music Theory
Instruments will be provided!
Outcome - End of batch group Recitals

We have a flexible Hop On Hop Off schedule and will be happy to fit it within your summer holiday plans.
Let the kids sweat it out with some music. They will love it.

name: Good Christian Girls Don't Talk About Caste - An Evening of Anti-Caste Poetry and Conversation
description:
Bangalore!
We are bringing you the Dalit feminist writer and Instagram-famous poet Aleena all the way from Kochi for evening of poetry and conversation.
If you haven't already been following her spoken word poetry reels and detailed analysis of caste and culture that tends to piss off people at the top of the oppression pyramid, then you're missing out. Aleena is the author of Silk Route (2021), a collection of 91 Malayalam poems that explores horror, politics, mythology, colourism, mythology, gender, and caste. She was awarded the Kerala Sahitya Akademi Kanakashree Award in 2022, but more importantly, Aleena’s poetry is an unabashed, inimitable love song to her lived and observed realities; her work is a magnificent, reckless laugh in the face of a society that makes absurdly clumsy attempts to stifle freedom and the agency of marginalised women.
✨ Join us for an intimate evening on Wednesday the 23rd from 7:30 PM to 9:30 PM, as Aleena reads her English poetry and sits down for a powerful, honest conversation with Rheea Mukherjee (author of The Body Myth (2019) and The Girl Who Kept Falling in Love (2023) and an outspoken advocate for mental health, social equity, and emotional truth) exploring Aleena's observations of the absurdities of caste, class, gender, religion, and the everyday magic of resistance.
🎤 The evening will close with a Q&A session, giving the audience a chance to connect, reflect, and engage.
🧡 This is a safe space for expression, listening, and community.
We do not tolerate any form of discrimination based on caste, gender, sexuality, religion, class, disability, or neurodivergence. Anyone engaging in hateful, harmful, or disrespectful behaviour will be asked to leave. No debate. No discussion. Marginalised voices are at the centre of this gathering — come with care or don’t come at all.

name: Get Serious About Nonsense - A Workshop on Making Meaning of the Absurd
description:
What if you were told nonsense isn't random. From manufactured outrage in news cycles to advertising's linguistic sleight of hand, from legal documents that read like absurdist theater to TikTok trends that defy explanation—these seemingly meaningless fragments are quietly but constantly reshaping our reality. What if the cultural static you mindlessly scroll past – viral dance trends, reality TV drama, and daily soap dialogues that make you cringe – isn’t really mindless and impacts your life? This is your chance to find out how. Decide hidden architecture of language and images that slips between logic's cracks constructing your worlds.
This workshop is an intellectual excavation. We'll dissect the patterns lurking beneath the surface of cultural absurdity, using critical tools to understand how meaning is constructed, manipulated, and occasionally demolished. It's an invitation to think differently: to see the elegance in the profoundly ridiculous.
Who Should Attend? 
Curious minds who consume media critically, who love intellectual provocations, and who believe that understanding our world requires looking beyond the obvious. Led by a cultural critic who knows that serious thinking can—and should—be playful, irreverent, and ridiculously insightful.
 
Aastha D. is a writer, critic, and educator working at the intersections of art, architecture, design, and cultural theory. She writes for publications such as wallpaper*, Metropolis, The Hindu, Architectural Digest, and Tribune UK, and has worked with leading artists, designers, and institutions to craft narratives that push boundaries and provoke thought. Aastha holds a graduate degree from Columbia University, where she specialized in critical theory and built environments.
She is the founder of Proseterity, an independent publication on art, culture, and criticism, where she also runs Critiqala, its education vertical. Through workshops on critical thinking, media, and design, she creates spaces for deep inquiry and playful experimentation, helping participants sharpen perception and challenge dominant narratives.
At the core of her work is an obsession with how culture is constructed, how power is embedded in space and image, and how we can rethink the systems that shape our world.
To apply for a scholarship to attend this workshop, please fill out this form: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScNQRriWNRMsWb0MeASu65lsTUqnNku6RW-KxVUY6Zi4u6-QQ/viewform

name: Food In Indian Literature - Monthly Book Club
description:
Our emotions and memories are intrinsically related to the food we eat and the genre of food literature combines them in a way that helps us connect not only to our past and our present, to different cultures, and communities, values and rituals, events both life-changing and mundane but to each other as well.
So, if viewing the world through the lens of food and literature interests you, then join us to begin a dialogue on “Food in Indian Literature” and to celebrate those stories and their diversity. Each month with Prachi Grover, we will be reading our way through several powerful (and delicious) narratives.
April Read: Bhang Journeys by Akshaya Bahibala
We assure you that you will enjoy every single bite!
The session is free but registration is a must as we have limited spots available.
Prachi Grover is a culinary consultant and educator and is the founder of “From Words to Wok”; a community for people who to love to read and eat!

name: Antara's Day Out - Book Launch
description:
🌟 Get ready for a magical adventure!
Awwa Pustaka presents Antara’s Day Out — a fun-filled book launch happening on April 26th at Atta Galatta.
Join us for a day of stories, laughter, and imagination — perfect for kids and anyone who loves a good tale. Come celebrate with us!
Event is FREE for all. But registration is a must.
Please confirm your attendance by registering — we don’t want to run out of snacks! 🥪🍪

name: Pen & Latte - Story Writing Workshop
description:
Atta Galatta and Aristotles Writers Club cordially invite you to the latest Writers Meetup in town. 
Join fellow wordsmiths and storytellers for an inspiring afternoon of creativity at our Writers Club Meet event in the cozy ambiance of the library cafe. Whether you're a seasoned author, aspiring novelist, or just passionate about penning your thoughts, this gathering is your opportunity to connect with like-minded individuals. Unleash your creativity and let your words flow in the company of kindred spirits at our Writers Club Meet.
Bring along your notebook, laptop or tablet and delve into a shared writing experience.
What does it entail?
- Involving in an ice breaker extravagant game.
- Writing a story based on a prompt.
- Participating in the curated feedback discussion.
- Following community guidelines.
Community Guidelines:
- Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
- Listen more. Speak mindfully.
- No monopolizing the conversation.
Event Sections:
1. Let’s chuckle and giggle - Intro yourself & let's play an interesting fun Game to break ice cubes. [15-20 mins]
2. Take your Pen out Writing segment 1 - Write an outline of your Story as an individual, based on a prompt given by the host [10-15 min].
3. Let's Learn Together - We will learn a writing technique with detailed analysis and literature case studies.
4. Take your Pen out Writing segment 2 - Now write the complete story using the newly learned technique. [25-30 mins]
INTERMISSION: CHILL & CHAT
5. Sssh! Open your PowerPoint -  Present your newly written story to a fellow participant and get feedback [30 - 40 mins].
6. Awards Galleria - A Surprising session for the participants.
7. Say Butter - Click that Snap button for a group picture.
Disclaimer on Event Coverage:
- Event highlights will be captured through photos and videos for showcasing the event in our social media accounts.
- All Event media will be shared with the participants upon request.

name: Warli Art Workshop - Art Course
description:
Discover the world of Warli Art - A Tribal Art. Warli Art is one of the oldest art from North Sahyadri by the Adivasis, A tribal art that depicts the bond between humans and nature. Art is mainly a culmination of geometric shapes depicting the lifestyle and beliefs of the Warli Tribe. This art is originated from Maharashtra, where it is still practiced today and is also popular around the world.
A good form of art to start with your basic art skills, easy on any age and gets you interested in the Indian art culture.
You need not have any prior experience in drawing or painting in order to attend this course.
Note: All Materials will be provided by the host.
What will you take home?
Knowledge of Indian Art Culture
Learn an ancient art form
Completed piece of artwork done by yourself
What do you need to bring?
Water bottle to keep you hydrated.
This workshop includes all materials, if required kindly get an Examination Pad / Paper Board.
Kindly be on time, entry of the participants will not be allowed late beyond 15 minutes.
No refunds on cancellations.

name: Go Go Flamingo! - Book Launch
description:
Join us for the launch of Go Go Flamingo, Tulika Books’ latest title, with the talented illustrator Priya Kuriyan! In this book, a flock of flamingos flies south in search of food and drink. What they find in the water causes a hullabaloo… They get draped and decked in unspooled tape, rubber tyres, shoes, plastic bags, syringe-needles, even rear-view mirrors! Unaware of their doom, they break into a dance in a confused trance.
Priya Kuriyan brings the irony alive through stunning visuals. Real objects imaginatively placed together with her drawings create a lifelike three-dimensional effect. Along with Devashish Makhija’s brilliant verse soaked in satire, they paint a telling picture – of the violence unthinking humans inflict on the natural world through hazardous waste.
About the Illustrator
Priya Kuriyan is a children's book writer-illustrator, comics maker and chronic doodler. She has directed educational films for the Sesame Street show (India) and the Children's Film Society of India (CFSI) and has illustrated numerous children's books for publishers like Tulika Books, Penguin, Scholastic and Hachette to name a few. In 2019, she was the recipient of the Big Little Book award, instituted by Parag, an initiative of Tata Trusts in recognition of her contribution to Indian children's literature. Her most recent children's picture book 'Beauty in Missing' was published by Pratham Books, India. She lives and works in the city of Bangalore.

name: BWW Short Story Community - Literary Meetup
description:
The BWW Short Story Community
This month we will discuss the short story Fire Rain from Heart Lamp: Selected Stories by Banu Mushtaq.
What this is:
This is a ticketed, curated literary and community event, presented by Bhumika Anand from the Bangalore Writers Workshop, where we will do a deep-dive analysis and discussion of a short story.
You get to join a reading community where you will get to read a pre-chosen short story a month.
You get to examine the story in terms of its literary merit, yes, but also in terms of writing craft and context, which will be very useful if you are an aspiring storyteller or writer.
Who should join:
If you are above 18 years old, interested in storytelling, literature, or are an aspiring or published author, this is for you.
If you are new in the city and want to be part of a community and make friends over writing,storytelling, and literature, then this is for you.
What does it entail:
Reading the prescribed story.
Participating in the curated discussion.
Following community guidelines.
Community Guidelines:
Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
Listen more. Speak mindfully.
No monopolising the conversation.

name: Let Poetry Be - Poetry Open Mic
description:
This monthly gathering will see poetry coming to life, through reading, music, art and any other forms of artistic expression, at Atta Galatta. Listeners and performers are all welcome!
Date: 26th April
Time: 4pm
Venue: Atta Galatta, Indiranagar
Event specifics & submission guidelines –
1. Theme - Free verse (any original work)
2. Works can be original or of other poets, performed live
3. All languages welcome
4. Participants can read to music (acoustic instrument/s), dramatise, use props & costumes
5. Each participant will enjoy 5 minutes of reading time
6. Kindly submit your poem and name to letpoetrybe@gmail.com on or before 24th April, midnight. WE WILL NOT ACCEPT ATTACHMENTS OR LINKS. SUBJECT OF YOUR MAIL MUST READ AS 'Entry for -Free verse, April meet-up '
7. You may also send entries that are not related to the theme
8. The event will begin at 4pm sharp and will be held at Atta Galatta. Participants to report not later than 3:45 pm to hear about performance order and meet the host
9. For any further clarifications, write to us at letpoetrybe@gmail.com
You are now welcome to flood our inbox!

name: The AG Lit Sisters - Monthly Book Club
description:
The AG Lit Sisters Book Club – Meetup #2
📚✨ A celebration of Sisterhood & Female Friendships! ✨📚
After the incredible success of our first meetup, The AG Lit Sisters Book Club is thrilled to announce our second gathering! This time, we’re diving into the heartwarming theme of Sisterhood & Female Friendships, exploring stories that celebrate the bonds between women—whether through books, personal experiences, or shared literary journeys.
What to Expect?
💬 Thought-provoking discussions on books that highlight sisterhood and friendships
🎭 Fun activities and bookish icebreakers
🎁 Exciting surprises for our members!
Join us for an evening of engaging conversations, shared love for literature, and an opportunity to connect with like-minded readers who cherish meaningful stories.
Come for the books, stay for the friendships! 💕📖 We can’t wait to see you there!

name: Write Like A Pro - Book Launch
description:
Have you ever sat down to write only to find yourself staring at a blank page? Or had the perfect words in your head, but they seemed to disappear the moment you tried to put them on paper? If you've nodded along, you're in the right place.
Write Like a Pro: 10 Rules to be a Better Writer is a much-needed guide for aspiring writers, authors and students. Whether you're just beginning your writing journey or you are a seasoned professional looking to hone your craft, this book offers practical advice, insightful examples, and thoughtfully designed exercises to help you unlock your full potential as a writer.
For the inexperienced, this guide provides clear, actionable steps to build your skills. For the experienced, it challenges you to break the rules—but only when you truly understand them.
With a touch of humour and a wealth of wisdom, Write Like a Pro delivers specific tools to help you develop your unique writing philosophy. Start your journey toward mastering the art of writing today!
Kalyanaraman Durgadas is an alumnus of IIT Madras and IIM Calcutta and is a serial entrepreneur.
He is an award-winning author. His novels include Songs of the Cauvery and Sorcerer of Mandala.
He has written and staged many plays. Anthologies and popular newspapers have featured his short stories.
He mentors writers in writing and editing their works. Has conducted several workshops for writers in various aspects of writing and editing.
He has distilled his decades of experience into his latest Write Like a Pro, an indispensable guide for writers of all capabilities.
He lives and works in Bangalore.

name: Let's Talk About Shame - Wellness Workshop
description:
Shame is among the most painful & detrimental emotions one experiences in a lifetime. A sense of worthlessness or undeservingness to exist consume those afflicted by shame. The pivotal role of shame is seen in maladaptive experiences such as shyness, addiction, loneliness, persistent anxiety, low mood and interpersonal behaviors including appeasement, hiding discontent, affirming to partner abuse/neglect, violence and preoccupation/avoidance
This workshop intends to help individuals understand shame in self and relationships, the experiences which may have played a role in shame overwhelming one’s experiences and strategies to address shame.
The workshop is organised by Dr Mathai Fenn, Dr Nimesh George And Dr Gokul Ratakonda, all of whom are practising psychotherapists and psychologists.
performer:
Gokul R. , 
Mathai Fenn, 
Nimesh George,

name: RCB Quiz - Sports Quiz
description:
Ee Saala Quiz Namde! Get Ready for the Ultimate RCB Quiz Experience!
It’s that time of the year again! Our minds are buzzing with India’s mega cricket carnival, and our hearts are brimming with love for our favourite team—RCB!
This is your chance to relive those unforgettable moments from RCB games, dive into fun facts about the legendary players, and celebrate your fandom with fellow die-hard supporters!
Peripheral Vision Collaborative is thrilled to bring you RCB Quiz – Inaugural Edition!
Join us for a day of fun, excitement, and RCB magic at Atta Galatta, Indiranagar on April 27th, 2025 at 11 AM!
🎤 Hosted by: Navneeth Krishna – Television Presenter & former host of RCB 12th Man TV
 🎬 Co-hosted by: Neerav Ghosh – Filmmaker, Author & Director/Producer of Breakfast with Champions
Form your dream ‘2-member team’ and put your cricket knowledge to the test!
Don't wait – REGISTER NOW and lock in your spot!
Will you come out on top?

name: Queer Quiet Hours - Meetup
description:
No agenda. No icebreakers. Just a cozy space, kind people, and time to just be—draw, journal, knit, doodle, zone out... whatever feels good. 💭🖍
We’ll have some optional art stuff, quiet corners, and probably a bit of wholesome chaos too. Bring a project or just bring yourself. That’s more than enough.
This space is exclusively for LGBTQIA+ folks. We haven’t opened it up to allies just yet—thank you for understanding. 🏳‍🌈
🌈 Spots are limited—sign up!

name: Scribble - Storytelling
description:
When was the last time you scribbled on the walls and your parents didn’t say a word? You love doodling on paper, but what about those forbidden floors, doors, and walls? Dive into our scribble-filled adventure, where creativity runs wild!
Meghna Shirish a mom, artist, and professional photographer who treats color like it’s her lifeline. If she had her way, she`d transform the entire city into a canvas of vibrant scribbles!

name: Read A Kitaab - Monthly Book Club
description:
📖 Theme: Books That Healed You
📍 Venue: Atta Galatta, Indiranagar
📅 Date: Sunday, 27th April 2025
⏰ Time: 4:00 PM – 6:00 PM
📚 Join us for a thought-provoking discussion on books that healed you! Connect with fellow book lovers and celebrate literature that shapes perspectives!
Please note: This is for strictly bookish / literature conversation and no personal life discussions/rave or rant.

name: Two Volumes of Captivating Short Stories - Book Launch
description:
A Joy Ride!
The stories in the two volumes of captivating short stories by Vijay Padaki are packed with a variety of plots and a charming range of characters. The first volume is The First Offering and Other Stories: Wagging Tales and the second volume is The Last Cheetah and Other Stories: Wagging Tales. They combine intriguing content with witty narration. The stories are kept short and sweet, never imposing, always entertaining.
Padmavati Rao, eminent theatre and film personality will be in conversation with the author to launch the books.

name: Music Camp 2025 - Music Summer Camp
description:
As we melt away this summer, we may as well do it to a beat. Taaqademy Presents - Music Camp 2025
Camp Content

Song Learning - Students will develop a repertoire of songs that they can perform
Everyone gets exposed to and gets to touch and feel all instruments - Gtr, Drums, Keys, Ukulele, Percussion, Vocals.
Students can choose a preferred stream of learning: Guitar, Keyboard, Drums, Vocals. (Or our teacher can help you choose too)
Music Appreciation - designed to enrich the student's listening experience by introducing various instruments, genres, history & evolution of styles, artists.
Basic Music Theory
Instruments will be provided!

We have a flexible Hop On Hop Off schedule and will be happy to fit it within your summer holiday plans.
Let the kids sweat it out with some music. They will love it.

name: Gond Art Workshop - Art Workshop
description:
Indian Gond Art - A Tribal Folk Art practiced by one of the largest tribes in India called Gondi, from Madhya Pradesh. The history of the Gond people dates nearly 1400 years from the Dravidian origin and this community has a unique painting style that makes extensive use of dots, fine lines, dashes and other geometric shapes.
The imagery of these paintings are borderless, bold and loud.
Blended with mystery, humour, these art pieces depict a modern psyche.
A great form of art to start with your basic art skill, interesting and electrified art that gets you fascinated about Indian Art Forms!!
You need not have any prior experience in drawing or painting in order to attend this course.
Note: All Materials will be provided by the host.
What will you take home?
Knowledge of Indian Art Culture
Learn an ancient art form
Completed piece of artwork done by yourself
What do you need to bring?
Water bottle to keep you hydrated.
This workshop includes all materials, if required kindly get an Examination Pad / Paper Board.
Kindly be on time, entry of the participants will not be allowed late beyond 15 minutes.
No refunds on cancellations.

name: Curios Minds, Conscious Choices: The Power of Asking Why - Meetup
description:
How does the content you consume shape your thoughts, decisions, and behavior?
Are you curious about the root causes of human behavior?
Do you want the freedom to challenge every statement and engage in an open discussion?
Looking for unbiased answers to your toughest questions?
Join us for an interactive Q&A-based session that encourages critical thinking and questioning!
This session is part of #MyConsumptionMyResponsibility, an initiative by Simon Jakkam aimed at raising awareness about how information, media, and content consumption profoundly impact our thoughts, behaviors, and overall well-being—especially among young minds.
What Makes This Session Unique?
✅ 100% Q&A-based: No lectures—only real discussions! I’ll answer questions directly from the audience.
✅ Challenge My Answers: You can counter-question every statement I make until you're completely satisfied with the response.
✅ Root-Cause Analysis: My responses will go beyond surface-level explanations and focus on why things happen the way they do.
Why Is This Important?
With digital consumption at an all-time high, even young children are exposed to unfiltered content that shapes their thinking and behavior—often without them realizing it. They cannot filter what’s right or wrong. This makes mindful consumption a necessity, not a choice. Understanding its impact is the need of the hour as it influences every aspect of life.
Come, challenge, question, and discover how mindful consumption can transform your life!

name: Queer Quiet Hours - Meetup
description:
No agenda. No icebreakers. Just a cozy space, kind people, and time to just be—draw, journal, knit, doodle, zone out... whatever feels good. 💭🖍
We’ll have some optional art stuff, quiet corners, and probably a bit of wholesome chaos too. Bring a project or just bring yourself. That’s more than enough.
This space is exclusively for LGBTQIA+ folks. We haven’t opened it up to allies just yet—thank you for understanding. 🏳‍🌈
🌈 Spots are limited—sign up!

name: Music Camp 2025 - Music Summer Camp
description:
As we melt away this summer, we may as well do it to a beat. Taaqademy Presents - Music Camp 2025
Camp Content

Song Learning - Students will develop a repertoire of songs that they can perform
Everyone gets exposed to and gets to touch and feel all instruments - Gtr, Drums, Keys, Ukulele, Percussion, Vocals.
Students can choose a preferred stream of learning: Guitar, Keyboard, Drums, Vocals. (Or our teacher can help you choose too)
Music Appreciation - designed to enrich the student's listening experience by introducing various instruments, genres, history & evolution of styles, artists.
Basic Music Theory
Instruments will be provided!
Outcome - End of batch group Recitals

We have a flexible Hop On Hop Off schedule and will be happy to fit it within your summer holiday plans.
Let the kids sweat it out with some music. They will love it.

name: Queer Quiet Hours - Meetup
description:
No agenda. No icebreakers. Just a cozy space, kind people, and time to just be—draw, journal, knit, doodle, zone out... whatever feels good. 💭🖍
We’ll have some optional art stuff, quiet corners, and probably a bit of wholesome chaos too. Bring a project or just bring yourself. That’s more than enough.
This space is exclusively for LGBTQIA+ folks. We haven’t opened it up to allies just yet—thank you for understanding. 🏳‍🌈
🌈 Spots are limited—sign up!
